frame.name: Visitor_and_host
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Visitor</fen> and a <fen>Host</fen> become co-located at a location strongly associated with the <fen>Host</fen>. The <fen>Visitor</fen> is allowed by the <fen>Host</fen> to use the <fen>Host</fen>'s location and/or resources for the achievement of a <fen>Purpose</fen>. The visit is often social in nature.</def-root>

FE.name: Visitor
FE.definition: <def-root>The sentient entity that heads toward and is temporarily with the <fen>Host</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Host
FE.definition: <def-root>An individual that allows the use of his or her resources for the benefit of the <fen>Visitor</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The activity that is enabled by the <fen>Host</fen> and that the <fen>Visitor</fen> wishes to achieve.</def-root>

FE.name: Normal_location
FE.definition: <def-root>The location that the <fen>Visitor</fen> normally resides in or is (permanently) associated with.</def-root>

FE.name: Host_location
FE.definition: <def-root>A location strongly associated with (in the territory of) the <fen>Host</fen>, often a place of residence, government, or employment. The <fen>Visitor</fen> is allowed onto the <fen>Host_location</fen> and may be invited to make use of it or resources contained within it.</def-root>
